messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/admin.php`, I found that `UserController::class` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/users`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/admin.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `UserController::class`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Here are the files that contain a class named UserController in the codebase. These are the files that implement a UserController class, which you may encounter when tracing the handler for the /users route or related endpoints.

- app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php

Explanation:
- The routes/admin.php file imports App\Http\Controllers\Admin\UserController and registers resource routes for users (with only index, edit, update). Therefore, the actual request handling for the admin /users endpoints is implemented in app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php.
- There are also UserController implementations in other namespaces that serve different parts of the application:
  - app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php (likely used by API routes under App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1)
  - app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php (a more general or non-admin UserController)
- For generating the OpenAPI spec focused on the admin route /users, you should concentrate on app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php. The other UserController files correspond to different routes/groups (API, default web) and would be relevant only if you’re documenting those other endpoints.
- If you plan to map the admin routes to OpenAPI, you’ll document the methods exposed by Admin/UserController (at minimum index, edit, update, as defined by the routes). To be thorough, you may also review the other two UserController files if you plan to document the API or non-admin user-related endpoints as well.
